Package com.atakmap.android.hierarchy

Class HierarchyListAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.atakmap.android.hierarchy.HierarchyListAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener, android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, PointMapItem.OnPointChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnMapMovedListener
    public class HierarchyListAdapter
extends android.widget.BaseAdapter
implements AtakMapView.OnMapMovedListener, PointMapItem.OnPointChangedListener, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
    This is the main list adapter used by Overlay Manager (OM) List items are pulled from map overlays registered to MapView.getMapOverlayManager()

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  HierarchyListAdapter.ItemDistanceComparator
      Sorting by item distance from a point of interest (usually self location)
      protected static class  HierarchyListAdapter.ListModelImpl
      The top-level list model
      protected static class  HierarchyListAdapter.SearchResults
      The list used to display search results
      protected class  HierarchyListAdapter.SelectionTask
      Task for finding items based on selection paths

        protected boolean buildRootList()
        This method builds the root list of Overlay Manager Each registered map overlay is scanned and its list model is pulled out to be displayed in Overlay Manager
        Returns:
        True if successs, false if failed (OM no longer active)

      • findListByPath

        protected HierarchyListItem findListByPath​(HierarchyListItem root,
                                           java.lang.String path)
        Find list given a backslash delimited path
        Parameters:
        root - The top-level list to begin the search from
        path - The path string (usually returned by getCurrentPath(com.atakmap.android.hierarchy.HierarchyListItem))
        Returns:
        The matching list item (or root if not found)

      • setSelectedPaths

        public void setSelectedPaths​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> paths)
        Set the list of selected paths

        A path is made up of each list item UID separated by backslashes i.e. \Markers\Mission\Marker-UUID

        Parameters:
        paths - Collection of paths to select

      • getSelectedPaths

        Pushes the specified list onto the list view.
        Parameters:
        item - The list item
        ifSublistExists - If true the list will only be pushed if it has one or more children. If false, it will always be pushed.
